alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 10:58AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow Wing Counties. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Aitkin and Crow Wing Counties. .Warm temperatures last week caused rapid snowmelt from a deep snowpack. This resulted in strong increase river flows. Cooler temperatures have allowed some rivers to crest however additional precipitation is expected Thursday which may cause delayed river crests. Snow is expected for northern tier basins. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Snake River near Pine City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, A few of the lowest dwellings adjacent to the Snake River, Cross Lake and Pokegama Lake need protection from flood waters. At 9.0 feet, This will cause flooding near Cross Lake near Pine City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet this evening. This forecast contains 24 hours of forecast precipitation and there is potential for heavy rain on Thursday. Therefore the forecast crest may be delayed and potentially higher than this forecast. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 04/18/1965. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Snake River Pine City 9.0 9.5 Tue 10 am CD 9.4 9.3 9.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 615 PM CDT.
